properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the Scaleway objectstorage bucket

properties.name: server
properties.description: (Optional) ID of server to associate IP with

properties.name: reverse
properties.description: (Deprecated) Please us the scaleway_ip_reverse_dns resource instead.

properties.name: enable_default_security
properties.description: (Optional) default: true. Add default security group rules

properties.name: stateful
properties.description: (Optional) default: false. Mark the security group as stateful. Note that stateful security groups can not be associated with bare metal servers

properties.name: inbound_default_policy
properties.description: (Optional) default policy for inbound traffic. Can be one of accept or drop

properties.name: outbound_default_policy
properties.description: (Optional) default policy for outbound traffic. Can be one of accept or drop

properties.name: security_group
properties.description: (Required) the security group which should be associated with this rule

properties.name: boot_type
properties.description: (Optional) the boot mechanism for this server. Possible values include local and bootscript

properties.name: public_ip
properties.description: (Optional) set a public ip previously created (a real ip is expected here, not its resource id)

properties.name: volume
properties.description: (Optional) attach additional volumes to your instance (see below)

properties.name: public_ipv6
properties.description: (Read Only) if enable_ipv6 is set this contains the ipv6 address of your instance

properties.name: state
properties.description: (Optional) allows you to define the desired state of your server. Valid values include (stopped, running)

properties.name: cloudinit
properties.description: (Optional) allows you to define cloudinit script for this server

properties.name: state_detail
properties.description: (Read Only) contains details from the scaleway API the state of your instance
You can attach additional volumes to your instance, which will share the lifetime of your scaleway_server resource.
Warning: Using the volume attribute does not modify the System Volume provided default with every scaleway_server instance. Instead it adds additional volumes to the server instance.
Warning: Some instance types require an additional volume to work. This includes for example START-1M and VC1M. If you run into this issue add an additional volume of the specified size.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of volume. Can be "l_ssd"

properties.name: size_in_gb
properties.description: (Required) The size of the volume in gigabytes.

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) public key of the SSH key to be added

properties.name: expires
properties.description: (Optional) Define if the token should automatically expire or not

properties.name: email
properties.description: (Optional) Scaleway account email. Defaults to registered account

properties.name: password
properties.description: (Optional) Scaleway account password. Required for cross-account token management

properties.name: server
properties.description: (Required) ID of server to associate the user data with

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Required) The key of the user data object

properties.name: value
properties.description: (Required) The value of the user data object

properties.name: size_in_gb
properties.description: (Required) size of the volume in GB

properties.name: volume
properties.description: (Required) id of the volume to be attached
